info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid for six months at time of entry

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One page required for entry stamp

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Polio vaccination up to 1 year before travel is recommended. See the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Fact Sheet

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: At least three months from the date of arrival

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One page required for entry stamp

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for U.S. citizens. If you are a U.S. citizen and intend to stay more than one year in Albania, you will need to apply for a residency permit.residency permit.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: A yellow fever vaccination certificate is required for travelers aged 1 year or over arriving from countries with risk of yellow fever transmission. A list of those countries can be found by visiting the  World Health Organization (WHO) .

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: 1,000,000 lekë (approximately $9,500 USD, though the rate can fluctuate) or equivalent.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: 1,000,000 lekë (approximately $9,500 USD , though the rate can fluctuate) or equivalent. For more information you can visit  Albanian Customs website.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes, unless entering via cruise ship or traveling to certain cities in the south of Algeria.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Travelers must declare at Customs if they are traveling with more than 3,000 Algerian dinar or foreign currency that exceeds 1,000 euros (or equivalent)

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Algerian dinars cannot be taken out of the country

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Valid for at least the planned duration of stay

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: No. U.S. passport holders on tourism are eligible for visa-free entry for stays of up to 30 days at a time (90 days total per calendar year). All other travelers must obtain a visa or visa pre-approval.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Yellow fever no longer required for USCs

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Up to the equivalent of $10,000 in combined currency (See currency regulations below)

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid at time of entry

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One page required for entry stamp

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays of 90 days or less

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Up to $10,000 USD or equivalent undeclared for those over age 16; up to $5,000 USD or equivalent undeclared for those under 16

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Up to US$10,000 or equivalent undeclared for those over age 16; up to US$5,000 or equivalent undeclared for those under 16

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid at time of entry and departure

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: None for U.S. Citizens staying for less than 180 days per year

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid at time of entry

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One page required for entry stamp

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes – visa or Electronic Travel Authority (ETA)

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Amounts over AUD 10,000, or equivalent, must be declared

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Amounts over AUD 10,000, or equivalent, must be declared

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Six months validity recommended, at least 3 months validity beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area is required.

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: Two pages required for entry stamp

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays under 90 days within each 180-day period

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: For a complete list of recommended vaccinations, please see the CDC country page on Austria.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Travelers may bring in any amount of foreign currency as long as they declare it upon arrival.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Travelers may depart with up to $10,000 undeclared, or up to $50,000 or equivalent if they provide documents showing they declared the amount to customs upon arrival.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Passports must be valid at time of entry through departure (throughout the duration of stay).

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: Two pages are required for entry stamp.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Visitors must declare currency and other negotiable instruments of $10,000 or more upon entry.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Visitors must declare currency and other negotiable instruments of $10,000 or more upon exit.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes. Visa on arrival is available for some travelers. Check the Bangladeshi Embassy website for the latest information.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Hepatitis A and Typhoid vaccinations required; Hepatitis B, Japanese Encephalitis, and Rabies vaccinations recommended. There is no risk of Yellow Fever in Bangladesh; however, proof of Yellow Fever vaccination is required if you are traveling from a country with a risk of Yellow Fever and are older than one year of age.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: You must declare 5,000 U.S. dollars and above.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: You cannot depart with more USD than you declared upon entry. You cannot take more than 5,000 Bangladeshi taka (appx. $58.82 USD) out of Bangladesh without a declaration. More information is available here: Bangladesh Customs, National Board of Revenue (NBR)

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid at time of entry

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays under 6 months

info.data: Must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned date of departure from the Schengen area. The 12-page U.S. emergency passport is not valid for visa-free entry into Belgium.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays under 90 days

info.data: Not required for stays of 30 days or less

info.data: Not required for stays under three months

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Amounts exceeding 10,000 Euros or equivalent require a bank certificate that the amount has been taken out from currency savings or bought from an authorized bank.

info.data: One page is required per entry stamp; please note endorsement pages are not considered blank passport pages.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: The import of local currency (Riel) is prohibited. When entering Cambodia foreign currency amounts over US $10,000 must be declared.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: The export of local currency (Riel) is prohibited. Foreign currency can be taken out of the country up to the limit declared at customs on arrival.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: While there are no official restrictions, travelers are required to make a declaration when they are exiting with XAF 3,000,000 or more.

info.data: Covid 19 vaccination is required upon entry.  Without proof of vaccination, a negative PCR test issued not more than 48 hours prior to entry to Chile is required.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes. Travel to Cuba for tourist activities remains prohibited by statute. See 31 C.F.R 515.560 and OFAC's Frequently Asked Questions.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: U.S. credit and debit cards do not work in Cuba.  You should bring U.S. dollars or Euros to Cuba and exchange them for Cuban Pesos (CUP) at authorized banks, CADECA offices, airports or hotels. Travelers should confirm alternative payment options before traveling, as policies concerning the use of U.S. dollars in Cuba are subject to change. The Cuban government requires that travelers declare cash amounts over the equivalent of 5,000 USD.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: When departing Cuba, we advise U.S. travelers to spend or exchange CUP to a foreign currency well before reaching airport security checkpoints.  Currency exchange houses in the departure area at airports are currently closed and Cuban pesos are not internationally convertible outside of Cuba..  International airlines flying to the United States include departure fees and taxes in the price of airline tickets.  U.S. dollars are not accepted for payment of any additional products purchased at the airport. Under Cuban law, travelers may export up to the equivalent of 5,000 USD out of the country.  Anyone wishing to depart Cuba with more than this amount of cash must demonstrate evidence that the currency was acquired legitimately from a Cuban bank.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Travelers must declare currency in amounts greater than $10,000. See the Ecuadorian customs website.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: There is a 5 percent tax on currency taken out of Ecuador above $1200.00. See the Ecuadorian Revenue Service website.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Passport must be valid at time of entry.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: A visa is not required for stays under 90 days, but you must purchase a tourist card for 12 USD upon arrival. The card is valid for 90 days. If your U.S. passport shows you were born in El Salvador, you do not need the tourist card.

info.data: None, check recommendation in Health Section.

info.data: Proof of vaccination for yellow fever and polio required. A polio booster dose is required for those who have completed the normal series of the polio vaccine.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Yellow fever certificate required if traveling from a country with risk of yellow fever transmission; recommended for all areas in Ethiopia except Afar and Somali regions.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: 1,000 ETB for all travelers; 1000 USD or other foreign currency equivalent if person resides in Ethiopia; 3,000 USD or other foreign currency equivalent if person is not residing in Ethiopia. Excess currency may be confiscated.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: 1,000 ETB (4,000 ETB if travelling to Djibouti) and 3,000 USD or other foreign currency equivalent.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Required: Honduras currently requires travelers arriving from or traveling to Panama and every nation in South America to present proof of yellow fever vaccine. Effective March 22, 2023: Travelers are no longer required to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or negative test results for a PCR, Antingen, or ELISA test prior to entry in to Honduras. Airlines may still require additional documentation prior to boarding. Suggested: measles, rubella, rabies, hepatitis A, hepatitis B, typhoid.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: No minimum requirement, but your authorized stay will not exceed the validity remaining on your passport and airlines may decline boarding if a traveler has fewer than six months validity on his or her passport.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Must declare all foreign currency upon arrival. Doing so helps to ensure travelers will be allowed to depart Malawi with foreign currency.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: $5,000 is the maximum amount of foreign currency with which travelers may exit the country. Funds in excess of this amount (and previously undeclared upon arrival) may be confiscated and travelers may be arrested for failure to declare the foreign currency. Currency regulations are controlled by multiple entities, change often, and are not consistently applied by authorities. Citizens have spent months detained while Malawi authorities attempt to determine which regulations apply.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Six months beyond date of arrival

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: At least one blank page required for entry stamp

info.data: Not normally required for stays of less than 90 days.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Passport must be valid at time of entry

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes, if visiting for more than 180 days

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: A valid international certificate of vaccination is required for travelers coming from a region infected with smallpox, yellow fever, or cholera. Current measles vaccine is recommended due to an outbreak in the area the last quarter of 2019. As of July 28, 2023, proof of COVID-19 vaccination is no longer required for entry into the FSM.  The lifting of the vaccination mandate applies to all, whether FSM citizens, nationals, non-citizens, nonresident workers, diplomats, crew of vessels or aircraft, and contractual personnel of foreign governments and international organizations.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: You must declare amounts equivalent to $10,000 or above.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays of up to 90 days within a six-month period

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Six months from date of entry.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays of fewer than 90 days. All visitors must register with  Mongolian Immigration within 48 hours of arrival.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Mongolian law requires travelers to declare any cash, financial instruments, and cryptocurrency equal to or greater than 15 million Mongolian tugrik (MNT), approximately 5,250 USD as of September 2020, in value to a customs official upon entry into Mongolia.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Mongolian law requires travelers to declare any cash, financial instruments, and cryptocurrency equal to or greater than 15 million Mongolian tugrik (MNT), approximately 5,250 USD as of September 2020, in value to a customs official upon their exit from the country.

info.data: Must be valid at time of entry

info.data: Not required for stays under 90 days

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: No vaccines are required to enter Montenegro.  For the most updated and detailed information please visit the Embassy’s COVID-19 information page.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: US $5,000; Pure/raw/unworked gold and silver are strictly prohibited; Worked gold/jewelry up to 50 grams and worked silver/jewelry up to 100 grams are allowed. Indian currency in denominations greater than 100 rupees notes

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: US $5,000; Pure/raw/unworked gold and silver are strictly prohibited; Worked gold/jewelry up to 50 grams and worked silver/jewelry up to 100 grams are allowed; Indian currency in denominations greater than 100 rupees notes

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: A passport must be valid for at least three months beyond planned date of departure from the Schengen area. The 12-page U.S. emergency passport is not accepted by Dutch authorities for visa-free entry into the Netherlands.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Yellow fever vaccine is required for individuals above nine months of age who are traveling to Sri Lanka from a country designated by the World Health Organization (WHO) to have a risk of yellow fever transmission, including transit more than 12 hours in an airport located in such a country. For more information, please refer to WHO.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Import of Tunisian currency is prohibited. Visitors must declare cash brought into Tunisia in excess of TND 10,000 (or foreign currency equivalent). They must declare amounts above TND 5,000 if they wish to export that amount upon departure.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Export of Tunisian currency is prohibited. Up to TND 3,000 may be re-exchanged into foreign currency upon departure from Tunisia with the original exchange receipt. Visitors may only export up to TND 5,000 (or foreign currency equivalent) if that amount was declared upon arrival.

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One page required for entry stamp.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: None required. Vaccinations recommended by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.Vaccinations recommended by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: The amount of U.S. dollars or any foreign currency may not exceed the total declared by the traveler upon entry. If it does, the traveler must present bank documents showing the source of the additional currency.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Not required for stays under 30 days.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: All travelers must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. No other vaccinations are currently required.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: Amounts over VUV 1,000,000 (USD 10,000) in local or foreign currency equivalent must be declared.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: Amounts over VUV 1,000,000 (USD 10,000) in local or foreign currency equivalent must be declared.

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: Two pages, for visa and entry stamp.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes. You must get a Venezuelan visa before traveling to Venezuela. Visas are not available upon arrival. Note:  U.S. travelers risk lengthy or indefinite detention for attempts to arrive at any Venezuelan border crossing without a valid Venezuelan visa.

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Yellow fever vaccination required if coming from or transiting for more than 12 hours through Brazil.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: USD 10,000 (or equivalent) or more must be declared.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: USD 10,000 (or equivalent) or more must be declared.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must have six months’ validity remaining.

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: One visa page required for entry stamp.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR ENTRY:
info.data: None. However, Vietnamese Dong in excess of VND 15,000,000 or foreign currency in excess of 5,000 U.S. dollars or equivalent must be declared.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: None. However, Vietnamese Dong in excess of VND 15,000,000 or foreign currency in excess of 5,000 U.S. dollars or equivalent must be declared.

info.title: PASSPORT VALIDITY:
info.data: Must be valid for six months at time of entry.

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes. Must be obtained at Yemeni embassies and consulates abroad.

info.title: BLANK PASSPORT PAGES:
info.data: 3 blank pages per entry for Zambia

info.title: VACCINATIONS:
info.data: Yellow fever, if entering from a yellow fever endemic country

info.title: TOURIST VISA REQUIRED:
info.data: Yes, to be obtained at port of entry.

info.title: CURRENCY RESTRICTIONS FOR EXIT:
info.data: $2,000 USD, more if declared/documented upon entry. See below.
